sen.j: 玉鬘（たまかずら）は『源氏物語』五十四帖の巻名のひとつ。
sen.e: Tamakazura is one of the fifty-four chapters of "The Tale of Genji."
Tamakazura is one of the fifty-four chapters of "The Tale of Genji."
Tamakazura is one of the fifty-four chapters of "The Tale of Genji."

sen.j: 第22帖。
sen.e: This is the twenty-second chapter.
This is the twenty-second chapter.
This is the twenty-second chapter.

sen.j: 夕顔 (源氏物語)の娘・玉鬘の半生を中心に描かれた巻。
sen.e: It describes mainly half a lifetime of Tamakazura, Yugao's daughter.
It describes mainly half the lifetime of Tamakazura, Yugao's daughter.
It describes mainly half the lifetime of Tamakazura, Yugao's daughter.

sen.j: 巻名は光源氏が詠んだ和歌「恋ひわたる身はそれなれど玉かづらいかなる筋を尋ね来つらむ」に因む。
sen.e: The title of this chapter was derived from the waka poem which Hikaru Genji composed, 'My love lives on as it did long ago, but tendril wreath, what winding stem led you to me?'
The title of this chapter was derived from the waka poem which that Genji composed, 'My love lives on as it did long ago, but tendril wreath, what winding stem led you to me?'
The title of this chapter was derived from the waka poem that Genji composed, 'My love lives on as it did long ago, but tendril wreath, what winding stem led you to me?'

sen.j: なお、「玉鬘」より「真木柱」までの十帖を玉鬘を主題としたひとまとまりの物語であるとする立場からまとめて玉鬘十帖と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: Some people consider that Tamakazura is a central figure in the ten chapters from 'Tamakazura' to 'Makibashira (The Cypress Pillar),' so these chapters are sometimes called Tamakazura ten folded books.

Some people consider Tamakazura as a central figure in the ten chapters from 'Tamakazura' to 'Makibashira (The Cypress Pillar),' so these chapters are sometimes called the ten folded books of Tamakazura.

Some people consider Tamakazura as a central figure in the ten chapters from 'Tamakazura' to 'Makibashira (The Cypress Pillar),' so these chapters are sometimes called the ten folded books of Tamakazura.

sen.j: 『源氏物語』の架空の登場人物の通称。
sen.e: The names of fictitious characters in "The Tale of Genji" commonly known by.
The names of fictitious characters in "The Tale of Genji" commonly known are:
The names of fictitious characters in "The Tale of Genji" commonly known are:

sen.j: 頭中将と夕顔の娘。
sen.e: Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) and a daughter of Yugao.
Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) and the daughter of Yugao.
Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) and the daughter of Yugao.

sen.j: あらすじ
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 光源氏35歳の3月から12月。
sen.e: Hikaru Genji, age 35, from March to December.
Hikaru Genji, age 35, from March to December.
Hikaru Genji, age 35, from March to December.

sen.j: 夕顔の遺児玉鬘は母の死後、4歳で乳母一家に伴われて筑紫国へ下国した。
sen.e: After her mother, Yugao, died, she goes down to the province of Tsukushi at the age of four, accompanied by a nursemaid.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After her mother, Yugao, died, she goes down to the province of Tsukushi at the age of four, accompanied by a nursemaid.
After her mother, Yugao, died, she goes down to Tsukushi province at the age of four, accompanied by a wet nurse.
sen.cmt: nursemaid→wet nurseに変更the province of Tsukushi→Tsukushi provinceに変更

sen.j: そして乳母の夫太宰少弐が死去した後上京できぬまま、既に20歳になっていた。
sen.e: Subsequently, her nursemaid's husband, Dazai no Shoni (junior assistant governor of Dazaifu, local government office in Kyushu region), passes away, and she has been stuck in there, not being able to return to Kyoto, turning twenty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Subsequently, her nursemaid's husband, Dazai no Shoni (junior assistant governor of Dazaifu, local government office in Kyushu region), passes away, and she has been stuck there, not being able to return to Kyoto, while turning twenty.

Subsequently, her wet nurse's husband, Dazai no Shoni (junior assistant governor of Dazaifu, local government office in Kyushu region), passes away, and she has been stuck there, not being able to return to Kyoto, while turning twenty.
sen.cmt: スペース削除nursemaid→wet nurseに変更

sen.j: その美貌ゆえ求婚者が多く、中でも有力者である肥後の豪族大夫監の強引な求婚に困り果ててしまう。
sen.e: Because of her beauty, there are many suitors, especially Gozoku (local ruling family) of Higo Province, Taifu no Gen (Audit Commissioner), is a leading figure and asks her to marry him aggressively, so she does not know what to do, fleeing to Kyoto by ship with nursemaid's eldest son, Bungonosuke.

Because of her beauty, there are many suitors, especially Gozoku (local ruling family) of Higo Province, Taifu no Gen (Audit Commissioner), is a leading figure and asks her to marry him aggressively, so she does not know what to do, fleeing to Kyoto by ship with nursemaid's eldest son, Bungonosuke.

Because she was a beautiful woman, there are many suitors, and she is unnerved by especially Taifu no Gen (Audit Commissioner), a leading figure of Gozoku (local ruling family) in Higo Province, who asks her to marry him aggressively.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そこで、長男の豊後介にはかって船で京に逃げ帰った。
sen.e: So she flees to Kyoto by ship with the help of nursemaid's eldest son, Bungonosuke.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: しかし京で母夕顔を探す当てもなく、神仏に願掛けし、長谷寺の御利益を頼み参詣の旅に出る。
sen.e: However, she feels at a loss for looking for her mother Yugao, making a petition to the gods and Buddha, and sets out for Hasedera Temple to seek divine favor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, she feels at a loss for looking for her mother Yugao, making a petition to the gods and Buddha, and sets out for Hasedera Temple to seek divine favor.
However, she does not know how she can find her mother, Yugao, so makes a petition to the gods and Buddha, setting out for Hasedera Temple to seek divine favor.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 椿市の宿で偶然、元は夕顔の侍女で今は源氏に仕える右近に再会した。
sen.e: At an inn in Tsubaichi, she happens to see Ukon again, who was once Yugao's maid and now is serving Genji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At an inn in Tsubaichi, she happens to see Ukon again, who was once Yugao's maid and now is serving Genji.
At an inn in Tsubaichi, she happens to see Ukon again, who was a former maid for Yugao and now serves Genji.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 右近の報告に源氏は玉鬘を自分の娘というふれこみで六条院に迎え、花散里を後見に夏の町の西の対に住まわせた。
sen.e: Genji, who has heard Ukon's story, takes Tamakazura in to Rokujo-in Palace as his own daughter, having her live in the west wing of the Summer-Residence and making Hanachirusato her guardian.
Genji, who has heard Ukon's story, takes Tamakazura in to Rokujo-in Palace as his own daughter, having her live in the west wing of the Summer-Residence and making Hanachirusato her guardian.
Genji, who has heard Ukon's story, takes Tamakazura in to Rokujo-in Palace as his own daughter, having her live in the west wing of the Summer-Residence and making Hanachirusato her guardian.

sen.j: 年の暮れ、源氏は紫の上とともに、女性らに贈る正月の晴れ着選びをした。
sen.e: At the end of the year, together with Murasaki no Ue, Genji chooses best clothes for his women to wear on the New Year's days.
At the end of the year, together with Murasaki no Ue, Genji chooses the best clothes for his women to wear on the New Year's days.
Together with Murasaki no Ue, Genji chooses the best clothes to wear on the New Year's days for his women at the end of the year.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 玉鬘の半生
sen.e: Half a lifetime of Tamakazura
The Half lifetime of Tamakazura
Half a lifetime of Tamakazura
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 玉鬘は頭中将と夕顔の間に生まれた娘で、幼名は瑠璃君といった。
sen.e: Tamakazura is a daughter between Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) and Yugao, and her childhood name is Rurigimi.
Tamakazura is the daughter of Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) and Yugao, and her childhood name is Rurigimi.
Tamakazura is the daughter between Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) and Yugao, and her childhood name was Rurigimi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 母夕顔は頭中将の正妻に脅され姿を隠していた時に源氏と出逢い、逢瀬の途中に不慮の死を遂げる。
sen.e: While her mother Yugao is hiding herself because she was frightened by Tono Chujo's legal wife, she meets Genji and dies an accidental death in the secret meeting with him.
While her mother Yugao is hiding herself because she was frightened by Tono Chujo's legal wife, she meets Genji and dies an accidental death in a secret meeting with him.
While her mother Yugao is hiding herself from Tono Chujo's legal wife, who threatened her, she meets Genji, but dies an accidental death in their secret meeting.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: しかし乳母たちにはそのことは知らされず、玉鬘は乳母に連れられて九州へ流れる。
sen.e: However, her maids are not let to know her death, and Tamakazura is taken to Kyushu region by the nursemaid.
However, her maids are not informed of her death, and Tamakazura is taken to the Kyushu region by the nursemaid.
However, her wet nurses are not informed of her death, and Tamakazura is taken to the Kyushu region by the wet nurse.
sen.cmt: maids→ wet nursesに変更nursemaid →wet nurseに変更

sen.j: そこで美しく成長し、土着の豪族大夫監の熱心な求愛を受けるが、これを拒んで都へ上京。
sen.e: She grows up to be a beautiful woman there, and is asked to marry by the local Gozoku, Taifu no Gen, eagerly, but she turns him down and returns to Kyoto.
She grows to be a beautiful woman there, and is eagerly asked to marry by the local Gozoku, Taifu no Gen, but she turns him down and returns to Kyoto.
She grows to be a beautiful woman there, and is eagerly asked to marry by the local Gozoku, Taifu no Gen, but she turns him down and returns to Kyoto.

sen.j: 長谷寺参詣の途上で偶然にも夕顔の侍女だった右近に再会、その紹介で源氏の邸宅・六条院に養女として引き取られる事となった。
sen.e: On her way to Hasedera Temple, she runs into Ukon, a woman who was once Yugao's maid, and through her good offices she is to be taken in to Rokujo-in Palace as an adopted daughter of Genji.
On her way to Hasedera Temple, she runs into Ukon, a woman who was once Yugao's maid, and through her good offices she is taken in to Rokujo-in Palace as an adopted daughter of Genji.
On her way to Hasedera Temple, she runs into Ukon, a woman who was once Yugao's maid, and through her good offices she is taken in to Rokujo-in Palace as an adopted daughter of Genji.

sen.j: 源氏の弟宮である蛍兵部卿宮をはじめ、髭黒、柏木 (源氏物語)（実は異母兄弟）など多くの公達から懸想文を贈られる。
sen.e: She is sent many love letters by Kindachi (high-ranking nobles) such as Genji's younger brother, Hotaru Hyobukyo no Miya, Higekuro, Kashiwagi (half brother by a different mother), and so on.
She is sent many love letters by Kindachi (high-ranking nobles) such as Genji's younger brother, Hotaru Hyobukyo no Miya, Higekuro, Kashiwagi (half brother by a different mother), and so on.
She is sent many love letters by Kindachi (high-ranking nobles) such as Genji's younger brother, Hotaru Hyobukyo no Miya, Higekuro, Kashiwagi (half brother by a different mother), and so on.

sen.j: 源氏の放ったホタルの光によって蛍宮に姿を見られる場面は有名。
sen.e: The scene in which Genji releases fireflies and Hotaru Miya sees her face in the dim light is well known.
The scene where Genji releases fireflies and Hotaru and Miya sees her face in the dim light, is well known.
The scene where Genji releases fireflies and Hotaru Miya sees her face in the dim light is well known.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 「行幸」で裳着をすませ、実父内大臣（頭中将）との対面を果たす。
sen.e: In the chapter of 'Miyuki (The Imperial Progress),' she celebrates her Mogi (coming-of-age ceremony for girls), and finally meets her real father Minister of the Center (Tono Chujo).
In the chapter of 'Miyuki (The Imperial Progress),' she celebrates her Mogi (coming-of-age ceremony for girls), and finally meets her real father, the Minister of the Center (Tono Chujo).
In the chapter of 'Miyuki (The Imperial Progress),' she celebrates her Mogi (coming-of-age ceremony for girls), and finally meets her real father, the Minister of the Center (Tono Chujo).

sen.j: 冷泉帝へ内侍司としての入内が決まるが、出仕直前に髭黒と突然結婚。
sen.e: She is to enter into court as Naishi no tsukasa (female palace attendants), but right before her entering she suddenly gets married to Higekuro.
She is to enter into court as Naishi no tsukasa (female palace attendant), but just before she enters, she suddenly is married to Higekuro.
She is to enter into court as Naishi no tsukasa (female palace attendant) of Emperor Reizei, but just before she enters, she suddenly is married to Higekuro.

sen.j: その後髭黒との間に男児（侍従の君）、大君（冷泉院女御）、中君（今上帝 (源氏物語)尚侍）をもうける。
sen.e: Later, She bears him a baby boy (Jiju no Kimi (a chamberlain)), Oigimi (a consort of Emperor Reizei), Naka no kimi (Naishinokami of Kinjo no Mikado (Emperor)).
Later, She bears him a baby boy (Jiju no Kimi - a chamberlain), Oigimi (a consort of Emperor Reizei), Naka no kimi (Naishinokami of Kinjo no Mikado - Emperor).
Later, She bears him a baby boy (Jiju no Kimi - a chamberlain), Oigimi (a consort of Emperor Reizei), Naka no kimi (Naishinokami of Kinjo no Mikado - Emperor).

sen.j: 田舎で生い立ちながら母よりも聡明で美しく、出処進退や人への対応の見事なことよと源氏を感心させた（なお「竹河」で玉鬘の後日談が語られる）。
sen.e: In spite of being brought up in the countryside, she is more intelligent and beautiful than her mother, and Genji is impressed by her course of action and way of handling people. (In the chapter of 'Takekawa (Bamboo River),' a sequel to her story is told.)

In spite of being brought up in the countryside, she is more intelligent and beautiful than her mother, and Genji is impressed by her course of action and way she handles people. (In the chapter of 'Takekawa (Bamboo River),' a sequel to her story is told.)

In spite of being brought up in the countryside, she is more intelligent and beautiful than her mother, and Genji is impressed by her course of action and way she handles people. (In the chapter of 'Takekawa (Bamboo River),' a sequel to her story is told.)

sen.j: 「玉鬘」とは毛髪の美称辞。
sen.e: Tamakazura' is an eulogistic name for hair.
Tamakazura' is an eulogistic name for hair.
Tamakazura' is an eulogistic name for hair.

sen.j: 毛髪は自分の意に反して伸び続ける事から、文学では古来「どうにもならない事」「運命」を象徴する。
sen.e: Hair keeps growing against our will, therefore hair has been a symbol of 'something beyond human control' or 'destiny' in literature since ancient times.
Hair keeps growing against our will, therefore hair has been a symbol of 'something beyond human control' or 'destiny' in literature since ancient times.
Hair keeps growing against our will, therefore hair has been a symbol of 'something beyond human control' or 'destiny' in literature since ancient times.

sen.j: 『源氏物語』に登場する玉鬘も数奇な運命と自らの美しさが引き起こす騒動に翻弄され続けた女性である。
sen.e: Tamakazura in "The Tale of Genji" is also at the mercy of her fate due to the incidents triggered by her hapless fate and beauty.
Tamakazura in "The Tale of Genji" is also at the mercy of her fate due to the incidents triggered by her hapless fate and beauty.
Tamakazura in "The Tale of Genji" is also at the mercy of her fate due to the incidents triggered by her hapless fate and beauty.

sen.j: また、平安時代には長い髪の美しさは女性の美そのものであった。
sen.e: In the Heian period, a woman with long hair meant a woman of beauty.
During the Heian period, a woman with long hair was a woman of beauty.
During the Heian period, a woman with long hair was a woman of beauty.

sen.j: 以上の事から玉鬘は、作者・紫式部が物語に張りめぐらせた伏線の妙を伝える登場人物とも言える。
sen.e: From the above, it can also be said that Tamakazura is a character which the author Murasaki Shikibu used for dropping hints of things to come in the story.
From the above, it can also be said that Tamakazura is a character which the author Murasaki Shikibu used for dropping hints about things to come in the story.
From the above, it can also be said that Tamakazura is a character which the author Murasaki Shikibu used for dropping hints about things to come in the story.
